meanings.definition: To cause (a liquid) to flow in a steady stream
meanings.sent1: I pour water into the glass.
meanings.sent2: She likes to pour milk on her cereal.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to pour the water from the bowl into its mouth.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight seemed to pour through the window.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall continued to pour down the rocks.

meanings.definition: To flow or fall in a steady stream
meanings.sent1: The rain started to pour down from the sky.
meanings.sent2: The river water began to pour over the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The juice decided to pour out of the container all at once.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to pour out of her like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The sand poured out of the hourglass, marking the time.

meanings.sent1: He will pour the tea into the cups for us.
meanings.sent2: The waiter will pour the wine into your glass.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to pour drinks for the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to pour out with every cup of tea she poured.
meanings.sent5: The bartender would pour the perfect cocktail every time.
